sub_title: Director Expertise in Labour Mobility | Founder CareerProfessor.works | Director i-graduate N. America & Europe | RvT Codarts | Making Mobility Work for organizations & people
summary:
Making Mobility Work is my motto. I'm passionate about customising solutions for global mobility for study and work purposes, mainly in my role as director of Expertise in Labour Mobility (ELM).

Pivotal in my work is the understanding of employability and supporting people and organisations’ ability to study and work across borders and between cultures. I thrive when making the connecting between education and the world of work. Happy to do so while using my extensive knowledge and networks regarding what makes people internationally employable, which is build through assignments for corporate clients, (regional) governments and higher education institutions across the globe. 

I combine my work for ELM with my role as Director Client Services Europe & North America for i-graduate – a leading benchmarking organisation responsible for the International Student Barometer (ISB). However, I'm most proud to be involved in the educational gaming app CareerProfessor.works, a new venture of ELM bridging education to the world of work. 

Key areas of knowledge & skills: 
- Expert in international recruitment & cultural differences in CV and resume writing
- Experienced in doing business across borders
- Accurate communicator around international HR and expat policies 
- Knowledge provider on graduate recruitment and how to enhance employability
- Working to close the gap between Higher Education and the international world of work 
- Consultant, trainer, researcher and writer in this field

"With over 25 years of advising employers, universities and governments on labour mobility, Nannette is one of Europe's leading experts on mobility for study and work."​

treasury_media.title: The why-how-what in Graduate Employability
treasury_media.description: Graduate employability turns out to be one of the main motivators for study choice. But our research has shown that 87% of students want more careers advice to bridge the gap from education to the world of work. The educational gaming app CareerProfessor.works supports labour market ready graduates with 24/7 international careers advice.

projects.title: ErasmusCareers
projects.description:
Measuring the impact of mobility abroad on students’ career development remains challenging and the support they receive from universities in identifying and assessing competencies is modest. The Erasmus Careers project aims to ensure that the competencies gained on mobility are recognized by students and employers and contribute to the career prospects of Erasmus+ participants.

To accomplish this ambitious goal, the Erasmus Student Network (ESN), Universidad Autonoma de Madrid (UAM), Aristotle University of Thessaloniki (AUTH), Tilburg University (TU), Expertise in Labour Mobility (ELM), and The Lifelong Learning Platform (LLLP), have launched the Erasmus Careers project.

projects.title: ErasmusJobs
projects.description:
Participating in a mobility experience increases the long term employability of students (Erasmus Impact Study 2014). However, at the same time, youth in Europe is facing huge challenges to find a job right after graduation due to the challenging labour market and the lack of skills and working experience. For employers, a mobility experience is generally considered an asset as 64% believe international experience is important, but eventually, the obtained transversal skills and knowledge are the aspects that matter the most (92%). Why are the skills gained through a mobility experience not clear and why does this lack of recognition still exist?

In response to this, the Erasmus Student Network (ESN) is launching ErasmusJobs, an Erasmus+ KA2 project, to bridge the skills gap for the Erasmus Generation. The project is a collaborative cross-European partnership between ESN, Masaryk University, Leo-Net, Universidad de Alcala, European Institute for Industrial Leadership, Université de Mons, European University Foundation, Università degli Studi di Roma "Tor Vergata", and Expertise in Labour Mobility B.V.

contributors.headline: Director Expertise in Labour Mobility | Founder CareerProfessor.works | Director i-graduate N. America & Europe | RvT Codarts | Making Mobility Work for organizations & people

projects.title: ErasmusSkills
projects.description:
The Erasmus Skills project is composed of a multidisciplinary Consortium of partners with extensive expertise in different fields among which: experts in learning mobility (ESN and EUF), experts in labour mobility (Expertise in Labour Mobility - ELM), and comprehensive public universities (Universidad Autónoma de Madrid - UAM, Gent University - UGent-, Aristotle University of Thessaloniki - AUTH) representing students and university staff as direct participants and experts of the project activities.

In a nutshell, the Consortium gathers experienced staff from research, education and industry. In addition, the project quality will benefit from the involvement of associate partners or external advisors: Research Institute for Higher Education and Science, different Erasmus Student Network’s national organisations all over Europe and the Research Group on Education Policy Supranational.

projects.title: Careers Made in Rotterdam
projects.description:
Careers Made in… is a full day event aimed at retaining the best young professionals in a region. The Career Made in events are aimed at minimising the mismatch between international job seekers and the options a region offers. 
The ELM team sees the whole event through, from creating a website and registration procedure, to selecting the venue and the speakers in line with the concept of the event.

contributors.headline: Director Expertise in Labour Mobility | Founder CareerProfessor.works | Director i-graduate N. America & Europe | RvT Codarts | Making Mobility Work for organizations & people

projects.title: What drives an expat?
projects.description:
Whether travelling for work, or working for travel, people have gone to the ends of the earth for their job. This is certainly not a new trend; it’s been happening for many years. Experiencing travel and world culture have become paramount in the international labour market, so much so that without international experience, it’s as if a piece of the puzzle is missing... 
This book, celebrating 20 years of Expertise in Labour Mobility, highlights the stories and experiences of those living and working around the globe. It explains what drives world citizens to be mobile.

profile_positions.description:
With over 25 years of advising employers, universities and governments on graduate mobility, Nannette is one of Europe's leading experts on labour mobility for study and work purposes.

Her areas of expertise include international graduate recruitment, international labour mobility, and the practical aspects of living and working abroad. She has written extensively on international job-hunting and working conditions abroad. She co-authored over 40 books on working internationally & international career guidance (the series "Looking for work in ...")  and has written numerous articles on the topic of globalisation and the effects on international expat and HR policies. 
As the founder of Expertise in Labour Mobility, Nannette is often quoted as an expert when it comes to international labour mobility issues and cultural understanding reworking and doing business across borders.
profile_positions.title: Founder and Director

profile_positions.description:
Careerprofessor closes the gap between higher education and the world of work. With employability being more important than ever in Higher Education - both with regard to student decision-making, happiness and their willingness to recommend - higher education institutions have to think about the ROI of education. The CareerProfessor app brings gamification into global career advice, supporting students and alumni in their career progress and training their intercultural employability skills to be ready for the global (and virtual!) world of work. 

For more information: https://careerprofessor.works
profile_positions.title: Founder

profile_positions.description:
Nannette combines her role for ELM with her work as Director Europe & North America for i-graduate – a leading benchmarking organisation responsible for amongst others the International Student Barometer (ISB). Over 4.2 million student responses, the ISB is the largest student survey in the world. 

In her role for i-graduate Nannette is responsible for the International Student Barometer in continental Europe and North America. Both universities and national/regional Higher Education bodies in Belgium, Canada, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, Germany, Italy, Luxembourg, the Netherlands, Spain, Sweden and the US are being serviced by the office in Rotterdam, headed by Nannette.

More info Canada: https://www.i-graduate.org/where-we-work-canada
More info Europe: https://www.i-graduate.org/europe
More info US: https://www.i-graduate.org/north-america
profile_positions.title: Director Europe & North America

profile_positions.company: Codarts Rotterdam | University of the Arts

profile_positions.title: Member of the Supervisory Board (Raad van Toezicht)

profile_positions.description: Part of the 2022 & 2023 Trainer Corps Trainer Development Team: Leading the Induction Program for new Trainer Corps members; Developing a series of virtual enrichment trainings; Delivering in-person Training Labs; Developing and delivering modules of the Virtual Trainer Designation for TC members. And that's apart from working with an amazing group of talented and expert international higher education professionals in NAFSA's Trainer Corps!!
profile_positions.title: Member of the NAFSA Trainer Corps

profile_positions.description: I'm proud to be serving as advisory board member of the IMP Alumni Association. IMP stands for a MSc in International Public Management and Public Policy. It is a selective one-year graduate program that seeks to make students aware of the increasingly multinational and international nature of public management and public policy-making; to provide them with the scientific theories, concepts, and tools needed for analysing this international multi-level 'space', and to equip them with knowledge and experiences relevant to public careers with international dimension.
profile_positions.title: Advisory Board Member Alumni Association Master International Public Management & Policy (IMP)

profile_positions.description:
Appointed as HigherEd Industry 'Innovator in Residence' to work with Study Queensland on
the project, "Maximising Employability to Attract, Integrate and Retain International Talent for
Queensland". The IIR is a key initiative of Study Queensland, part of Trade and Investment Queensland, to advance Queensland. My role will be to enhance employability for international students in Queensland, Australia.
profile_positions.title: Innovator in Residence

profile_positions.description:
Mobility of labour is one of the four freedoms constituting the single EU market. The Harnessing European Labour Mobility (HELM) study aims to:
• apply a futures focus on the issue of European labour mobility
• conduct a 360° analysis of the political, economic, social, cultural and technological factors that could impact labour mobility in Europe 
• prioritize policy recommendations for the European Union, national governments, and other actors in the labour market.

Through input from a cross-disciplinary and pan-European advisory board, the Bertelsmann Stiftung and the Copenhagen Institute for Futures Studies (CIFS) have come up with 5 future scenarios for European Labour Mobility. The report can be found here: http://www.labourmobility.com/press-coverage/
profile_positions.title: Advisory Board Member for HELM: Harnessing European Labor Mobility

profile_positions.description:
Organised senior management level meetings, ranging from virtual events to 3 day summits for a network of multinational companies across the globe to structure and support a new way of looking at HR and thinking about corporate careers. Resulting in reports such as 'Riding the Wave - the new global career culture' and 'e-people - engaging talent in the entrepreneurial age'.
Ci Group Members included amongst others BA Systems, BP, BT, CGE&Y, Deutsche Bank, Deutsche Telekom, Diageo, Freshfields Bruckhaus Deringe, GlaxoSmithKline, Global One, Hewitt Associates, ING, Lufthansa, Marriott, PwC, Rolls-Royce, Reuters, UBS, Unilever.
profile_positions.title: Events Director
